alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 11 at 3:13AM AKDT until July 12 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, AND 224... .DISCUSSION... A thermal trough stretching from McGrath to Livengood to Eagle will persist today and then slide east Tuesday. A warm and unstable airmass associated with this will cause isolated to scattered thunderstorms across the Interior. Expect around 5000 lightning strokes today. Thunderstorm activity and associated abundant lightning should taper off from west to east, Tuesday into Wednesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT FOR LIGHTNING FOR UPPER TANANA VALLEY AND THE FORTYMILE COUNTRY... * AFFECTED AREA...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. * TIMING...Until Midnight AKDT Monday night. * LIGHTNING ACTIVITY LEVEL...4. * WINDS...Northwest 5 to 10 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 40 percent. * TEMPERATURES...65 to 75. * IMPACTS...Ample lightning could lead to numerous new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
